intro: Cienfuegosia yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan cienfuegosia, is a rare flowering plant native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in limestone soils and is adapted to the region's tropical climate. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of significant interest to botanists and conservationists.
